wordpressPost.title: Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup 6/12/2015
wordpressPost.content:
The WeSpire Employee Engagement Weekly News Roundup aggregates the top employee engagement articles from around the industry to keep you informed and inspire positive impact in your organization.

This One Thing will be Key For Businesses of the Future

With over 70% of employees reporting that they would like to get more involved in their businesses’ volunteer, sustainability, or well-being programs, it is essential that organizations of today strive to engage their employees in purposeful work. The article argues that as a leader, the most important thing you can do is to define your company’s purpose. Working to achieve this purpose will engage employees and consumers alike in creative ways. As a result, dedicated, satisfied employees will be more productive, and more consumers will stay loyal due to the positive social image.

Seven Strategies to Avoid Startup Culture Burnout

Startups are not the only workplaces in which one can find employees on autopilot, detached from their work after suffering through either an overly stressful environment or an overly monotonous routine for too long. Employee burnout is a prevalent problem that leaders of businesses in all stages of development must address. The author proposes seven strategies that managers can undertake in order to engage effectively with their employees to combat this issue.


How Do You Get People to Change? Incentives in Wellness Programs

It is common these days to see corporate wellness programs with financial rewards for those adhering to healthy habits (like getting routine physicals) and with financial penalties for habits companies are trying to break (like smoking). In theory, these programs would work well, but the author highlights pitfalls to avoid when designing the perfect program. First, many employees might feel it is a form of discrimination against them if they do practice unhealthy habits, so employers must ensure that their programs do not punish those who cannot reasonably make the behavior change. Lastly, the author stresses that wellness programs must not only rely on extrinsic motivation, but also foster intrinsic motivation if they hope to remain durable.


What Brand Persona? Only 62% of Companies Have A Formal Brand Platform

As more and more millennials enter the workplace, employers have the unique opportunity to start utilizing them to promote a formal brand platform that communicates company ethics and cultural vibes. When millennials today are choosing employers, the cultural feel of the company is a large factor in their decision-making process. Thus, it is imperative that companies are able to convey their corporate culture effectively. Yet, a recent study shows that employers are lacking in this regard, and the author outlines steps to remedy this common problem.

The 5 Leadership Behaviors You Need to Boost Employee Engagement

As a leader, how can you engage your workforce effectively? According to Deloitte’s 2015 Human Capital Trends report, 90% of those surveyed rank leadership as a top concern, making it imperative for managers to be able to connect effectively with employees. The author describes five behaviors leaders can practice in order to engage their workforce, promote a positive company culture, and boost morale.
